The anatomy of humane bodies epitomized wherein all parts of man's body, with their actions and uses, are succinctly described, according to the newest doctrine of the most accurate and learned modern anatomists / by a Fellow of the College of Physicians, London. Gibson, Thomas, 1647-1722.
[8], 510 p., 13 leaves of plates
Printed by M. Flesher, London : 1682.
Attributed to Thomas Gibson. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
=======
